meanings.definition: A person or thing that irritates or annoys.
meanings.sent1: The loud neighbors are real irritators with their constant parties.
meanings.sent2: The mosquito buzzing around my head is a tiny irritator.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock, my daily irritator, always wakes me up too early.
meanings.sent4: Her constant nagging was like having a swarm of irritators around me.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet was the persistent irritator that drove him crazy.

meanings.sent1: The irritators in the room were causing a lot of noise.
meanings.sent2: I could see the irritators gathering in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The irritators seemed to be having a party of their own.
meanings.sent4: The irritators swarmed around the picnic, looking for food.
meanings.sent5: The field was filled with irritators, each one buzzing around.
